reviews.sentence: Walking distance to Disneyland. Lack of restaurants around the area.

GOOD CHOICE FOR THEME PARK GOERS. The obvious plus of this hotel is it is location right across the street from Disneyland. Also the hotel is reasonably prices. The front desk staff and the valet parkers were all very friendly and they catered to families even to having a separate check in for kids. Although they do not have a restaurant as such they do have a Pizza Hut Express on the third floor that even serves breakfast. Rooms were average for a Fairfield Inn. Beds were comfortable. Only real complaint was that the vanity was a little tight. Room was clean. Good choice for Disneyland visitors.

Walls are like paper thin noise level unbearable. Great Location 5 minute walk to Disneylands front gate nice clean large romCons The walls are like paper thin our room was on the 5th floor the second room around the corner from the elevators and I could here the elevator tracks all day and night could not sleep this made my trip unpleasant. I could hear the next door baby crying probably because he. she could not sleep because their room was the 1st room next to the elevator. No microwave in room no continental breakfast and had to pay 150 a day for parking. no available parkingHigh Speed Internet access was so poor. Great Location 5 minute walk to Disneylands front gate. nice clean large room theme rooms Toy Story 5 minute walk to Disneyland main gate McDonalds restaurant next door to hotel. Advise customers not to get room as close to elevator because your walls are paper thin. High Speed Internet access was so poor.

Fun Family Hotel. Not a business property. To be entirely fair I am rating this up a full star due to the fact I made a mistake staying here. I am on a business trip and this is NOT a business hotel. it is a huge property right across the street from Disney and that is great. They have theme ish rooms and nice and helpful people. There is a McDonald in the parking lot. The first night I checked in very late and they did not have my Mariot status on file so I did not get a room on a higher and quieter floor. The air conditioner was so loud I woke up mid sleep with a migrane. I reported it in the morning and it was fixed for my next 2 nights. In the same morning the family next door was having a full out fight happy vacation. and I could hear every word for 3 hours through the paper thin walls. They checked out that day. It was not a very good start to the last stop on a 17 day road trip. What it does not have is anything I expect in a Fairfield including a business center free parking free breakfast so that is a real surprise at first. The parking is a reasonable 150 but the charge for everything on property does get old. No free breakfast no free coffee and I had to run to Staple to print some work documents. So if you are here for Disney and are looking for a great location to walk to the park this could be the hotel but for a business guy trying to work locally I had stay away. I have checked out early they were very nice about that and I am moving elsewhere in the Mariot family to a place that has the benefits I am used to as a Platinum member.

Successful Spring Break. Our family of four just returned from 5 days at the Fairfield. Overall it was a great stay. We were able to upgrade to a higher level theme room with a great park view. We were able to watch the fireworks from the room. It was a very short walk to the main gate for both Magic Kingdom and California Adventure. The third floor dining options were simple nothing extraordinary but handy. There are many options for non park dining which is expensive. We have stayed at a Disney Resort property which is very expensive the Fairfield was a great option for us.

Perfect Family Hotel for the Magic Kingdom. Put your car away. This hotel is a great place to stay for a family of four or smaller. it is right across the street from the park and you can walk to California Adventure Downtown Disney or The Magic kingdom. There are only a handful of hotels that are as convenient as this one. It has a small restaurant which is not complimentary and with a very limited menu but it is easy quick and relatively inexpensive. There is a McDonalds on the same street but we found it too crowded no matter what time we stopped in and the wait was longer then we were willing to endure. At least a 12 hour if not longer. There are no suites at this hotel only rooms with double beds or a King so if you are looking for privacy from your kids or have more then two this is not the place for you. Get one of the higher floors and you will have a beautiful view of the park. My only complaint was the Hotels recommendation of Starline Tours to Universal Studios. One of the worst most disorganized tours you will ever pay to use. They wasted so much of our time they should have paid us.

The Three CS. Clean comfortable and convenient. Friendly staff short walk to the park and very clean room for a good nights sleep. We upgraded our room facing the park to watch the fireworks outside our room on the 9th floor. Only thing missing would be breakfast included especially for families would be a plus but they have a market for breakfast biscuits etc also pizza hut. Macs is also right next door and pizza press very good thin crust on the way to the park.

Great Disney partner hotel. I stayed here in May for 5 nights. I was very pleased to be upgraded to one of their themed rooms. I got the Toy story room and it was very nice and clean. The view from my bedroom was a gorgeous view of Disneyland. The rooms had a safe which is quite small considering that there were two of us and both traveled with Ipads phones kindles and passports. The A C in my room broke and it would not stop heating the room the maintenance team were very quick to fix that once we had called the reception. The breakfast at the pizza hut express was very good but the evening service for pizzas was a bit slow as there is only one oven and a few orders were going in at the same time. However they made that up by having the best coffee. They have Seattles Best coffee. My reason for staying here was its proximity to Disneyland as I partook in the Tinkerbel half marathon weekend. It was very nice coming back after a morning run to find the staff welcoming us back with free bottles of water and a banner congratulating the runners. After the 10 K run I did make use of their hot tub and it was very pleasant. it fits around 5 adults and the bubble timer is 15 minutes long. There are two targets nearby and an outlet center 5 minutes away. There was also an IHOP and a tony romas down the block which was excellent as we love both those places and go everytime we are in the USAI have no complaints about this hotel at all and would definitely stay there again.

Convenient for Angels and Disney. Needed hotel in Anaheim for an Angels baseball game and a day at Disneyland. Hotel is definitely older with outside entrances though well maintained. While it is directly across from Disney it is definitely a no frills room and overall facility. It met the basic clean room and decent bedding criteria we were looking for a single night stay. The kids enjoyed the Disney themed décor. On premise restaurant was a counter service that we passed on for the McDonald ’s directly adjacent to the property. Did not use pool but appeared very crowded. Would stay again unles staying more than single night then we would seek something more “ resort ” like.

Exceptional. it is proximity to Disneyland is perfect. You can pop back to the room for rest mid way through the day if you need. Staff are very helpful. Buffet breakfast would have been nice. Hotel restaurant was pretty ordinary therefore did not eat there. There really was not anywhere close to get a decent meal. Closest was 3 large blocks away. Worth the walk but have comfortable shoes on.

Great location to Disneyland. This hotel is half a block from the entrance to Disneyland. The night security person was so nice to help us porter our bags as we arrived late at night. The housekeeping staff was very accommodating as we had a few late starts. The room is very spacious for 4 people. There is some construction in the parking lot but we could not hear any noise in the room. Overall a very awesome experience. McDonalds is right next door and provided a quick breakfast before our day in the parks. can not wait for Panera Bread to open in front of the hotel.

Great place for disney. I only gave 4 stars because you have to pay extra for parking and there is no free breakfast. It does have free wifi which is nice. But otherwise it is perfect for disney. It is about a 8 10 minute walk to either park from the hotel. There are reasonable dining places nearby within walking distance. You can see space mountain from the balcony of the hotel. And some of the rooms are character themed so it feels like a disney hotel.

Very Close To Disneyland. Nice Place a Mariot. Was very close to Disneyland about a 9 Minute walk or so not very long but very easy to get to Disneyland too. Was great having McDonalds in the parking grabbed breakfast before we went to park was great. Clean nothing real fancy or anything but was very clean and a lot cheaper than staying at any other hotel at least at the time I booked it.
it is convenient walking to Disneyland Resort and restaurants. Close to disneyland gate. If our room is close where the elevator is.

Great location. Great location to Disneyland park rooms were good downside was paying for parking and there was not really an in house breakfast. Breakfast was at Pizza Hut in the building with little selections. Mimis Cafe McDonalds and Panera are within walking distance for more options. Staff was friendly. Pool was well maintained. You could stream your own Netflix and other subscriptions through your in room TV which was a plus with kids.
How clean and close to all parks it is. Close to restaurants and you feel very safe in the area. Plus it ’s set further back from the main roads so you do not hear traffic from your room.

I like that there was a Pizza Hut Express on the third floor an area to do laundry a complete gym and heated pool. It was in walking distance to many restaurants stores and Disneyland. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. I wish that a complimentary breakfast was offered. It would ensure my choice to book there again for future trips.

The room was clean bed comfortable but did not accommodate 5 adults did not eat breakfast at location. Loved that hotel is walking distance to and from Disneyland. I did not like the fact that the room advertises room capacity for 5 people but only has 2 Queen beds and a chair. It is not accommodating for 5 adults.

Outstanding customer service. The best. We had the best weekend at fairfield. Our room was clean and very comfortable. You can walk to disney and mcdonalds within minutes. Tamara was so nice at the front desk and got us our room fast. The cafe on floor 3 and gym were right outside our door with breakfast to buy. Ca nt wait to stay here again next yr. Every person who worked here was beyond helpful and made our stay better.

Good 1. Walking distance to Disneyland entrance2. Clean3. The view4 Dedicated level for kids pizza snacks arcade5. Robust supply and gift shop6 very friendly and accommodating valet staf7. extra privacy barn door that separates bathroom from bed. This was great not just for extra privacy but also saves the rest of your family members from the bathroom sink lights while they ’re still in bed. No decent breakfast menu in house but McDonald ’s and Panera bread just outside the hotel.
